intro: Ranunculus decurvus, commonly known as the curled buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features delicate, showy flowers with five to eight yellow petals and a central cluster of yellow stamens. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm, with trifoliate leaves that are finely toothed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
